title: 6 maps predicting snowfall totals Sunday-Monday
author: John Waller
bullets: Southeast Massachusetts and Rhode Island expected to see the greatest snowfall impact from the storm Sunday night to Monday.
Weather forecasts predict heavy snow, strong winds, and potential coastal flooding, with power outages a significant concern in Boston.
Snowfall amounts could reach a foot or more in metro Boston, the South Shore, and Cape Cod according to meteorologists.

title: Lindsay Clancy appears in court for first in-person hearing since allegedly killing her children
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Lindsay Clancy, accused of killing her three children in 2023, appears in court in person for the first time.
Prosecutors and defense discuss logistics for Clancy's upcoming July 20 murder trial during the brief court hearing.
Clancy's defense claims postpartum mental illness and medication triggered a psychotic break leading to the alleged killings.

title: Cape Cod adopts transfer fee on home sales over $1 million
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Barnstable County Assembly approved a transfer fee for home sales over $1 million to fund housing initiatives.
The fee could generate up to $60 million annually, with 90% returned to towns for housing projects.
The proposed fee now moves to Massachusetts state legislature, where similar efforts have previously stalled.

title: Peabody police warn about ‘Northshore Mall takeover’
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Peabody police warned of a planned 'Northshore Mall takeover' on Friday at 3 p.m., prioritizing public safety.
The event involved large crowds engaging in car burnouts and drag racing, similar to prior incidents in Massachusetts.
Gov. Maura Healey issued a $14 million safety grant to prevent such events, denouncing them as public safety threats.

title: 7 members of ‘Harvard Street Gang’ face drug and firearms charges, authorities say
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Seven members of the Harvard Street Gang charged with drug and firearms offenses across Eastern Massachusetts.
Authorities seized 25 firearms, kilograms of drugs, and over $40,000 cash during coordinated searches.
Gang has been linked to shootings and drug trafficking; eight defendants currently in custody.

title: Al Horford says his decision to leave Celtics was ‘deeper than just the basketball’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Al Horford left the Boston Celtics after signing with the Golden State Warriors last offseason, citing factors beyond basketball.
Horford's decision to leave was influenced by the Celtics' financial moves aiming to reduce salary under the luxury tax.
Celtics coach Mazzulla praised Horford's impact and expressed gratitude for their professional relationship and respect for him.

title: Readers agree: Build a new Madison Park to benefit Bostonâ€™s youth
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Readers support rebuilding Madison Park Technical Vocational High School on parcel P-3 in Roxbury over mixed-use development.
Many believe the new school will offer valuable trade skills and careers without requiring college education for Boston's youth.
Concerns exist about the viability of previously planned mixed-use development due to changing market conditions.

title: Planned Parenthood rolls out vasectomies at Mass. health centers
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Planned Parenthood League of Massachusetts has started offering vasectomies at its health centers, beginning on Valentine's Day.
The procedure is currently available at the Worcester location after an in-person consultation at Boston, Worcester, Marlborough, or Springfield.
The demand for permanent contraception options like vasectomies has surged following changes in federal abortion protections in 2022.

title: Body of Eastham man who fell through ice located after days of searching
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Gerard 'Jerry' Boucher's body was found near Bee's River after falling through ice at First Encounter Beach on Feb. 14.
Both Jerry and his wife, Kathleen 'Kit' Boucher, drowned after falling through the ice; Kit's body was found the same day.
Eastham police expressed condolences and thanked regional partners for their efforts in locating Jerry Boucher's body.

title: MSP trooper dragged by vehicle during East Boston stop
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A trooper was dragged 10-20 feet by a car after a traffic stop in East Boston early Thursday.
Suspect Binit Bikram Shah, 27, from Raymond, NH, was later arrested and charged with multiple offenses.
Shah faces charges including DUI, controlled drug possession, and assault on a police officer.
